trans-unit.source: Azure AD iOS Getting Started | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure AD iOS Getting Started | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: How to build an iOS application that integrates with Azure AD for sign in and calls Azure AD protected APIs using OAuth.
trans-unit.target: How to build an iOS application that integrates with Azure AD for sign in and calls Azure AD protected APIs using OAuth.

trans-unit.source: Azure AD provides the Active Directory Authentication Library, or ADAL, for iOS clients that need to access protected resources.
trans-unit.target: Azure AD provides the Active Directory Authentication Library, or ADAL, for iOS clients that need to access protected resources.

trans-unit.source: ADAL’s sole purpose in life is to make it easy for your app to get access tokens.
trans-unit.target: ADAL’s sole purpose in life is to make it easy for your app to get access tokens.

trans-unit.source: To demonstrate just how easy it is, here we’ll build a Objective C To-Do List application that:
trans-unit.target: To demonstrate just how easy it is, here we’ll build a Objective C To-Do List application that:

trans-unit.source: Gets access tokens for calling the Azure AD Graph API using the <linkText>OAuth 2.0 authentication protocol</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Gets access tokens for calling the Azure AD Graph API using the <linkText>OAuth 2.0 authentication protocol</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Searches a directory for users with a given alias.
trans-unit.target: Searches a directory for users with a given alias.

trans-unit.source: To build the complete working application, you’ll need to:
trans-unit.target: To build the complete working application, you’ll need to:

trans-unit.source: Register your application with Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: Register your application with Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: Install & Configure ADAL.
trans-unit.target: Install & Configure ADAL.

trans-unit.source: Use ADAL to get tokens from Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: Use ADAL to get tokens from Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: To get started, <linkText>download the app skeleton</linkText><title></title> or <linkText>download the completed sample</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: To get started, <linkText>download the app skeleton</linkText><title></title> or <linkText>download the completed sample</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: You'll also need an Azure AD tenant in which you can create users and register an application.
trans-unit.target: You'll also need an Azure AD tenant in which you can create users and register an application.

trans-unit.source: If you don't already have a tenant, <linkText>learn how to get one</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you don't already have a tenant, <linkText>learn how to get one</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In order to securely launch your applications in certain SSO scenarios we require that you create a Redirect URI in a particular format.
trans-unit.target: In order to securely launch your applications in certain SSO scenarios we require that you create a Redirect URI in a particular format.

trans-unit.source: A Redirect URI is used to ensure that the tokens return to the correct application that asked for them.
trans-unit.target: A Redirect URI is used to ensure that the tokens return to the correct application that asked for them.

trans-unit.source: The iOS format for a Redirect URI is:
trans-unit.target: The iOS format for a Redirect URI is:

trans-unit.source: aap-scheme - This is registered in your XCode project.
trans-unit.target: aap-scheme - This is registered in your XCode project.

trans-unit.source: It is how other applications can call you.
trans-unit.target: It is how other applications can call you.

trans-unit.source: You can find this under Info.plist -> URL types -> URL Identifier.
trans-unit.target: You can find this under Info.plist -> URL types -> URL Identifier.

trans-unit.source: You should create one if you don't already have one or more configured.
trans-unit.target: You should create one if you don't already have one or more configured.

trans-unit.source: bundle-id - This is the Bundle Identifier found under "identity" un your project settings in XCode.
trans-unit.target: bundle-id - This is the Bundle Identifier found under "identity" un your project settings in XCode.

trans-unit.source: An example for this QuickStart code would be: *msquickstart://com.microsoft.azureactivedirectory.samples.graph.QuickStart*
trans-unit.target: An example for this QuickStart code would be: *msquickstart://com.microsoft.azureactivedirectory.samples.graph.QuickStart*

trans-unit.source: To enable your app to get tokens, you'll first need to register it in your Azure AD tenant and grant it permission to access the Azure AD Graph API:
trans-unit.target: To enable your app to get tokens, you'll first need to register it in your Azure AD tenant and grant it permission to access the Azure AD Graph API:

trans-unit.source: Sign into the Azure Management Portal
trans-unit.target: Sign into the Azure Management Portal

trans-unit.source: In the left hand nav, click on Active Directory
trans-unit.target: In the left hand nav, click on Active Directory

trans-unit.source: Select a tenant in which to register the application.
trans-unit.target: Select a tenant in which to register the application.

trans-unit.source: Click the Applications tab, and click Add in the bottom drawer.
trans-unit.target: Click the Applications tab, and click Add in the bottom drawer.

trans-unit.source: Follow the prompts and create a new Native Client Application.
trans-unit.target: Follow the prompts and create a new Native Client Application.

trans-unit.source: The Name of the application will describe your application to end-users
trans-unit.target: The Name of the application will describe your application to end-users

trans-unit.source: The Redirect Uri is a scheme and string combination that Azure AD will use to return token responses.
trans-unit.target: The Redirect Uri is a scheme and string combination that Azure AD will use to return token responses.

trans-unit.source: Enter a value specific to your application based on the information above.
trans-unit.target: Enter a value specific to your application based on the information above.

trans-unit.source: Once you've completed registration, AAD will assign your app a unique client identifier.
trans-unit.target: Once you've completed registration, AAD will assign your app a unique client identifier.

trans-unit.source: You'll need this value in the next sections, so copy it from the Configure tab.
trans-unit.target: You'll need this value in the next sections, so copy it from the Configure tab.

trans-unit.source: Also in Configure tab, locate the "Permissions to Other Applications" section.
trans-unit.target: Also in Configure tab, locate the "Permissions to Other Applications" section.

trans-unit.source: For the "Azure Active Directory" application, add the Access Your Organization's Directory permission under Delegated Permissions.
trans-unit.target: For the "Azure Active Directory" application, add the Access Your Organization's Directory permission under Delegated Permissions.

trans-unit.source: This will enable your application to query the Graph API for users.
trans-unit.target: This will enable your application to query the Graph API for users.

trans-unit.source: Now that you have an application in Azure AD, you can install ADAL and write your identity-related code.
trans-unit.target: Now that you have an application in Azure AD, you can install ADAL and write your identity-related code.

trans-unit.source: In order for ADAL to be able to communicate with Azure AD, you need to provide it with some information about your app registration.
trans-unit.target: In order for ADAL to be able to communicate with Azure AD, you need to provide it with some information about your app registration.

trans-unit.source: Begin by adding ADAL to the DirectorySearcher project using Cocapods.
trans-unit.target: Begin by adding ADAL to the DirectorySearcher project using Cocapods.

trans-unit.source: Add the following to this podfile:
trans-unit.target: Add the following to this podfile:

trans-unit.source: Now load the podfile using cocoapods.
trans-unit.target: Now load the podfile using cocoapods.

trans-unit.source: This will create a new XCode Workspace you will load.
trans-unit.target: This will create a new XCode Workspace you will load.

trans-unit.source: In the QuickStart project, open the plist file settings.plist.
trans-unit.target: In the QuickStart project, open the plist file settings.plist.

trans-unit.source: Replace the values of the elements in the section to reflect the values you input into the Azure Portal.
trans-unit.target: Replace the values of the elements in the section to reflect the values you input into the Azure Portal.

trans-unit.source: Your code will reference these values whenever it uses ADAL.
trans-unit.target: Your code will reference these values whenever it uses ADAL.

trans-unit.source: The tenant is the domain of your Azure AD tenant, e.g. contoso.onmicrosoft.com
trans-unit.target: The tenant is the domain of your Azure AD tenant, e.g. contoso.onmicrosoft.com

trans-unit.source: The clientId is the clientId of your application you copied from the portal.
trans-unit.target: The clientId is the clientId of your application you copied from the portal.

trans-unit.source: The redirectUri is the redirect url you registered in the portal.
trans-unit.target: The redirectUri is the redirect url you registered in the portal.

trans-unit.source: The basic principle behind ADAL is that whenever your app needs an access token, it simply calls a completionBlock +(void) getToken : , and ADAL does the rest.
trans-unit.target: The basic principle behind ADAL is that whenever your app needs an access token, it simply calls a completionBlock +(void) getToken : , and ADAL does the rest.

trans-unit.source: In the QuickStart project, open GraphAPICaller.m and locate the `// TODO: getToken for generic Web API flows.
trans-unit.target: In the QuickStart project, open GraphAPICaller.m and locate the `// TODO: getToken for generic Web API flows.

trans-unit.source: Returns a token with no additional parameters provided.` comment near the top.
trans-unit.target: Returns a token with no additional parameters provided.` comment near the top.

trans-unit.source: This is where you pass ADAL the coordinates through a CompletionBlock to communicate with Azure AD and tell it how to cache tokens.
trans-unit.target: This is where you pass ADAL the coordinates through a CompletionBlock to communicate with Azure AD and tell it how to cache tokens.

trans-unit.source: Now we need to use this token to search for users in the graph.
trans-unit.target: Now we need to use this token to search for users in the graph.

trans-unit.source: Find the // TODO: implement SearchUsersList commentThis method makes a GET request to the Azure AD Graph API to query for users whose UPN begins with the given search term.
trans-unit.target: Find the // TODO: implement SearchUsersList commentThis method makes a GET request to the Azure AD Graph API to query for users whose UPN begins with the given search term.

trans-unit.source: But in order to query the Graph API, you need to include an access_token in the Authorization header of the request - this is where ADAL comes in.
trans-unit.target: But in order to query the Graph API, you need to include an access_token in the Authorization header of the request - this is where ADAL comes in.

trans-unit.source: When your app requests a token by calling getToken(...), ADAL will attempt to return a token without asking the user for credentials.
trans-unit.target: When your app requests a token by calling getToken(...), ADAL will attempt to return a token without asking the user for credentials.

trans-unit.source: If ADAL determines that the user needs to sign in to get a token, it will display a login dialog, collect the user's credentials, and return a token upon successful authentication.
trans-unit.target: If ADAL determines that the user needs to sign in to get a token, it will display a login dialog, collect the user's credentials, and return a token upon successful authentication.

trans-unit.source: If ADAL is unable to return a token for any reason, it will throw an AdalException.
trans-unit.target: If ADAL is unable to return a token for any reason, it will throw an AdalException.

trans-unit.source: Notice that the AuthenticationResult object contains a tokenCacheStoreItem object that can be used to collect information your app may need.
trans-unit.target: Notice that the AuthenticationResult object contains a tokenCacheStoreItem object that can be used to collect information your app may need.

trans-unit.source: In the QuickStart, tokenCacheStoreItem is used to determine if authenitcation has already occurred.
trans-unit.target: In the QuickStart, tokenCacheStoreItem is used to determine if authenitcation has already occurred.

trans-unit.source: Congratulations!
trans-unit.target: Congratulations!

trans-unit.source: You now have a working iOS application that has the ability to authenticate users, securely call Web APIs using OAuth 2.0, and get basic information about the user.
trans-unit.target: You now have a working iOS application that has the ability to authenticate users, securely call Web APIs using OAuth 2.0, and get basic information about the user.

trans-unit.source: If you haven't already, now is the time to populate your tenant with some users.
trans-unit.target: If you haven't already, now is the time to populate your tenant with some users.

trans-unit.source: Run your QuickStart app, and sign in with one of those users.
trans-unit.target: Run your QuickStart app, and sign in with one of those users.

trans-unit.source: Search for other users based on their UPN.
trans-unit.target: Search for other users based on their UPN.

trans-unit.source: Close the app, and re-run it.
trans-unit.target: Close the app, and re-run it.

trans-unit.source: Notice how the user's session remains intact.
trans-unit.target: Notice how the user's session remains intact.

trans-unit.source: ADAL makes it easy to incorporate all of these common identity features into your application.
trans-unit.target: ADAL makes it easy to incorporate all of these common identity features into your application.

trans-unit.source: It takes care of all the dirty work for you - cache management, OAuth protocol support, presenting the user with a login UI, refreshing expired tokens, and more.
trans-unit.target: It takes care of all the dirty work for you - cache management, OAuth protocol support, presenting the user with a login UI, refreshing expired tokens, and more.

trans-unit.source: All you really need to know is a single API call, getToken.
trans-unit.target: All you really need to know is a single API call, getToken.

trans-unit.source: For reference, the completed sample (without your configuration values) is provided <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For reference, the completed sample (without your configuration values) is provided <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: You can now move on to additional scenarios.
trans-unit.target: You can now move on to additional scenarios.

trans-unit.source: You may want to try:
trans-unit.target: You may want to try:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Secure a Node.JS Web API with Azure AD >></linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Secure a Node.JS Web API with Azure AD >></linkText><title></title>
